text: John Henry Britton (1923 London â€“ 5 June 2004) was a English and Kenyan Paralympic swimmer. He later moved to the United States and worked as a teacher. == Life == Britton became paralyzed in 1966. It was caused by a fall at his home. He represented Great Britain at the 1968 Summer Paralympics where he had won a gold medal in freestyle swimming. After the Paralympics, he moved to Kenya. He represented Kenya at the 1972 Summer Paralympics in Heidelberg, Germany. He won a gold medal. Britton was aslo the Kenyan coach in Heidelberg. While living in Kenya, he worked to create a 40-bed hospital in the country for paraplegics.[5][6] Following the 1972 Games, Britton moved to the United States and took a teaching position at Northern Illinois University. He continued to live in the United States until his death in 2004 in Florida. == References == Category:1923 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Paralympic competitors for Great Britain Category:Kenyan sportspeople Category:British teachers
